I took it back and they were happy to exchange it so i picked up Charm instead. I am very happy with both colors I have now, Sweetheart is a bright pink that really gets noticed but I think it looks great! Charm is a peachy nude great for everyday.

These are so easy to use! I love them for on-the-go. They do go on glossy and stay for a very long time but they lose their glossiness long before the color fades, so you may need a lipgloss if you want that glossy look and feel.

name: Marsy
review:
This is great! I bought this in Honey, which is a lovely sheer pink that I think would work as a my-lips-but-better color for a wide range of skin tones. It's a bit sheer but can be built up, is not drying at all (I wouldn't use it as a moisturizer, though), and lasts for several hours and even through reasonably not-messy meals. It has a bit of a minty smell, which I enjoyed. The twist-up crayon form is convenient.

I also have the Revlon Colorburst Matte Balm in Sultry (another pink), and I find that the matte balm is much more pigmented. I would buy this again in another color or if/when I use it up.

name: Critter
review: I loved this product!! I wear it to work, when I'm going out. Or just whenever!!

name: Mlle_Milla
review:
I absolutely love these products! I have it in 2 shades ("honey" and "love sick"), but I definitely want to get more! Honey is a pinky-nude; it's great for everyday and looks great on women of color. Love sick is a very hot pink, perfect for a fun night out. It's VERY moisturizing and long lasting. With both shades, I went out (and even ate!) and there was still some shine to them HOURS (maybe 3 hours?) later. During a work day, I reapplied "Honey" maybe once. However, as honey dries it does look more dark pink than natural/nude but I like it!

The color is also buildable, you can wear it very sheer or add more layers to deepen the color. I also recommend using a lip liner because it makes it look much neater and cleaner. The shine and moisturizing effect lasts longer than I expected, but if you have drier, more chapped lips, I recommend exfoliating your lips to prep. It's very high quality and I highly recommend.

I would be careful with color selection. Try the test samples in store to figure out your best matches...depending on your skin tone some of the colors might look very similar on you. I tried it in "Cherish" but it did not really show up on me, I would not recommend that shade if you have a deeper skin tone. It's so light I should have realized. They are very true to their color. I want to get rendezvous, smitten, and/or cherish next!

name: Nula
review: All I got to say is "Love the product".

name: DGeorge
review: I like this product but I like the lip butters just slighty better.  Revlon makes good lip products for the price.  I would buy this product again.

name: Abigail the Beauty Addict
review:
I got the balm stain in "Romantic", hoping that it would be a nice, sheer sort of classic red. I will tell you that when I first opened mine up, I was a little intimidated! But I really like this color! It's very buildable, so I can layer it on if I want more POP! But one of my favorite things about this is that when I wipe it off, it still leaves a little bit of a cherry red/pink color on my lips, and it's still nice and shiny!

Now for the negatives... First off, the tip of the stick broke off after the first use, and made a HUGE MESS all over my face. Not fun! Luckily, it's retractable. Just be careful of how much pressure you use when applying! And second, that pepermint smell... At first, I hated it and found it much too strong, but I've gotten used to it and find it quite nice! Some people might find the smell unpleasant or distracting though. (Side note: even though it smells minty, has very little taste.)

name: Coastal Cali
review:
I have Bare Minerals "Light" skin tone (fair, yellow). I have very very light/whitish mauve lips, so I really like it when a lipcolor leaves some stain. I have tried 4 of these. Be aware, the starting color is not the same as the stain that is left. The stain tended to be brighter than the starting color. (Which makes sense.)and the packaging does not reflect color all that well. Also, I suspect the stain might come out differently on different people (chemistry?)
Smitten: Lovely deep fuschia when it goes on. Left a different and much brighter crazy fuschia stain that actually was pretty but way too bright for me. Think I will give this to a friend.
Crush: Lovely grape. The stain is fairly true grape, but sadly this was the only stain that sort of settled into lip lines a bit. I will keep trying.
Adore: nice sort of brick color, very wearable. Left a medium brick but slightly pinker/brighter stain. It is not "red lipstick" and might work for you if you tend to browns. Wish the stain left was more like the start color.
Honey: So different than package. Not pink. In the tube it looks like a nude. On, it is a mauvey nude, and the stain was more mauve. I could wear this all the time, just to get my lips to look normal lip color.

All went on lovely and smooth and soft. But all left my lips dry after balm wore off. Then at least on Adore and Smitten, re-app made for a really bright and unpredictable stain.

If you get this and find the stain too crazy bright, try applying over lip balm. That seemed to make the stain aspect softer. I think this product is best for someone like me who really needs some color to stick around, and is more concerned with having some color, than it being exactly the desired color!!
(and if the specific color is important, be sure to re-check in mirror frequently the first couple times you use so you can see how it develops on you.)

name: Iris5
review: My fifteen year old daughter purchased this lip stain. We are unable to rate the performance aspects of it because as soon as she applied it, her lips broke out in a raised, red rash. Obviously some ingredient in it caused an immediate allergic reaction. She has never had this reaction using any other lip gloss or lipstick in the past. We will be returning it.

name: M Ahmed
review: I really like this product because it does stain my lips and I don't usually have to reapply, BUT it makes my lips very dry. I can't use it everyday because, if I do, my lips dry out. I rarely try to use it because of the fact that it is extremely drying, but when my lips aren't dry and I put it on, my lips feel and look wonderful. Will recommend, but beware of the drying.

name: PAT champ
review: Limited color selection

name: taytay
review: I love this kissable lip color, right in between a gloss and a lipstick without the stickiness or the basic boring matte. Great for everyday, stays on all day through all of my classes

name: aasian
review: My skin tone is in between medium and deep (not sure why there are only three options, ridiculous) and the red shade looks great on me. What I like most about this product is that it comes on strong (but not as strong as lipstick) and by the end of the day it fades but the color still shows. Some might hate this, but I love it because I like the really natural lip color look; I'm not really a big fan of such bold lips for everyday. I use a TINY bit of Vaseline before I apply this lipstain, and it glides right on! I recommend this for those who like the natural lip look!

name: The Natural
review: Color stays on all day!

name: Minty Goblin
review:
I got Honey and Sweetheart. They both go on your lips the exact color of the tubes they come in, so you know what you're getting. I've worn Honey almost everyday since I got it- it goes with anything. Sweetheart is a bright pink with almost a slight berry hue to it, so it's a really fun color. Both colors last forever! I can go probably 5 hours before I notice any fading. I love the crayon-like application because all you have to do is color within the lines.
The only con for these stains is at first it goes on feeling like a balm, but the balm quickly fades and it ends up drying my lips out a little. However, I can totally live with that because the the color stays on forever even when the balm doesn't.

name: Klassie
review: I really love it.

name: CK
review: I love the way this product goes on and stays on! Super staying power!

name: Britt
review: I was really disappointed with the color. I thought I was getting a peachy/orange color gloss and instead it's tan. Almost the same color as my skin. Not cute...

name: Nurse-poo
review: will buy again

name: mhamediana
review: This is the perfect shade for fall for my skin tone! I finally found my perfect red! This balm stain is very long lasting. However,I found it to be a little drying after a while. Make sure that you have separate moisturizing lipbalm to re-moisture your lips.

name: Kclynne
review: My lips always feel soft when using this, but have to constantly reapply to keep the color looking fresh.

name: Makeup Monstarr
review: I love the convienience of this product. The price is nice and usually can get the best deals on these during a Revlon product sale plus store coupon. They glide on very nicely, and sort of do give you a moisturized feel. However, that moist feeling does seem to wear off after a bit. Sometimes I might have to top it with my favorite lip balm or a gloss. It does stain a bit, so you do get a long wearing effect. I've used other more prestigious lines and the moisturizing effects are better, but don't wear as long (don't stain). There is a little bit of a funny scent to these. Although, after wearing them for a few mins, you really don't smell it any more. Colors are pretty true to color and seem to be on the brighter side, unless you go for the softer nude tones, then of course they come out pretty natural. I say give them a try.

name: Neha
review: I loved the lip stains!!! I bought few for myself and few for my friends in India and got a great deal from Ulta. I love the pink shades especially Darling, cherish and Rendevous!!! They are moisturizing but you have to apply light shades more to keep them stay for long!! No complains and will definitely buy them again...they look absolutely delicious!!!

name: Louie's mom
review: I use this product first thing in the morning and don't need to reapply until mid morning. Love this stuff!

name: cdenell
review: Didn't last as long as I would have hoped, however my sister has the same product in a different color and loves it!

name: brianna
review: honey is such a pretty color! the only con is that it doesn't last too long.

name: D
review: I have been trying a few different lip stain products.  This is by far the best one yet.  I don't like lip stick.  During the winter my lips tend to dry out more than I'd like.  This is a great balm and lip stain in one.  I'm very happy with this product and will be going back for more colors.

name: Marie
review: I would recommend putting some sort of thin layer of chapstick or lip balm underneath this stain, and on top after application.

name: Laci
review: I was so excited to see these; I love lip balm/lipstick combos.  This product changes to a hideous color on my lips. It was embarassing when I went into the bathroom at church and my lips were a bizarre color.

name: The Pilots Wife
review:
I tend to lean toward a more natural look, but was hoping for a red for the holiday season. This turned out to be more of a deep burnt orange.
I will try this style in a different color.
Perhaps access to a tester would have made my purchase more satisfying.

name: Kit
review: I love this product, because it doesn't dry out your lips like lipstick does.

name: Janna
review: I use the product daily to add trendy color to my lips.  I like how long it lasts and how easy it is to use.  It's super simple application lasts longer than I expected.

name: Hill
review: I wish they offered more of a color selection in the Just Bitten Balm Stain.

name: Mikie
review:
I hung out with a friend and her lipstick looked perfect. I asked her what she was using and she pulled out this, and gave me the two color numbers she used. I tried hers and fell in love. I went out right away to pick up the same two colors and I love them! The colors are so vibrant and beauiful. They have a wide selection choice of color and apply perfectly! The lighter colors are perffect for spring and darker for fall/winter. I would definitely recommend this brand/kind to anyone.

Note: Lipstick feels like a minty chapstick, it makes your lips soft while giving it the perfect color.

name: Paulina
review: Great

name: robin
review: not long wearing

name: Amanda
review: Color was more orangey than package suggested. Returned item.

name: rose400
review: It is the best lipstain for everyday use, it last forever and it is very mosturising!

name: ParkGirlJen
review: Wonderful lip stain. It goes on a bit glossy and is quite moisturizing. After a couple of hours the glossy finish is gone and you are left with the lovely color stain. My favorite is the honey shade because its like my natural lip shade only better! Try this product!

name: Red-curlz-girl
review: Love the color! Doesn't last all day but it is easy to carry around for reapplication

name: Pattymelt
review: I've never loved a make-up purchase so much.  I bought other colors right after receiving this one in the mail.  The color LOOKS overpowering on the crayon, but it applies much lighter, and you can certainly decide how intense you want the color.

name: Miss Vargas Lady
review:
I LOVE these!
Honey- natural mauve color with a touch of violet.

A perfect daily color for fall.

These last a decent length and look beautiful as long as you've prepped your lips well: exfoliate (baking soda or sugar or salt etc. with water) then lightly moisturize with a good quality non-waxy balm, coconut oil, argan oil etc.)

I just wish they had more colors!

name: Crystal Leigh
review: I love this lip stain! It goes on smoothly. It contains a balm so it doesn't dry your lips out. Before you know it it feels as if you have nothing on your lips but the color is still there!

name: bhio
review: lip balm + color stain = hassle free lipstick. it's the best all-in-one i've ever had. I only apply it twice in a day.

name: mynameisname
review: i really do love this product because it last a very long time and it's still moisturizing. it really does stain your lips, i ate and brush my teeth and the color is still there. i love the feel of it on too. but the only problem with this is that it's too pricey for a drugstore brand. i mean it is a good product, but drugstore are suppose to be less pricey. but i love it anyways

name: Corre
review: It's a great all day wear and doesn't leave lip marks on cups. Plus I can kiss my husband with no worries of leaving lipstick on his face.

name: ShePotterGleek
review:
I got this after reading some of the reviews here.
This is my first lip anything besides chap stick. I like it. It is lightweight, but just has an odd texture on your lips. I got it yesterday, and wore it today at school. I think it was faded after about two hours. I got the honey, and it's a good color, and little darker then I excepted. I put it on, but I don't like how it looks when you rub your lips together, so I like, pat it with my finger; it looks better to me, anyway.
Overall I like it, I did just get it, so I'm still getting used to it. But I will probably keep using it.

name: Hedgey
review: I like that it is not as drying as some stains I have bought, but it smells weird

name: mary
review: i love that i can drink or eat and a fair amount of the lipstick is still on my lips. without lipstick i feel so pale. with this brand i need not worry, i look like i still have some color so i add a little more and voila ready to rock and roll.

name: Lindsay
review:
I really really wanted to like these balm stains after reading rave review after rave review about them, but I have been so disappointed.

One of the more frustrating things about this product is the fact that the colors are nothing like they show in the swatches on the website and I've had a difficult time finding a color that looks good on my skin tone.

Also, for me, the "stain" aspect of this product falls short. I can put this balm on and after half an hour, the gloss and shine is gone--which isn't a big deal, but the remaining stain factor on my lips is hardly noticeable...

Overall, for me, this product has been nothing but a pain and I would be hesitant to recommend it to others.

I will spend my money on the original Just Bitten stain + balm combo. The colors are better and the stain aspect is far more impressive.

name: Lawyer by Day, Fashionista by Night
review: I got this in the color cherish.  Great everyday lip product.  Easy to use and work appropriate.  Put lip balm on your lips first, but it stays all day, even after food and beverage.

name: Gotarealjob
review: I have purchased this product in several colors after buying it the first. It has a wonderful peppermint scent. It has a creamy texture and wonderful coverage. It works great with a lip liner as well.

name: Amos
review: This is the easiest to apply lipstain on the market. Smooth, shine & lasting color. I will never by another lipstain, 24 hour lipcolor, 10 hour lipstick or any other clumping, cracking, dull product again!

name: ProTools
review: I have several of the high end lip stains like the Chubby Stick, but the only difference between their product and Revlon is price.  Revlon performs as well at a 1/3 of the price.  Well done.

name: Bellyrina
review: Applies easily and feels nice on the lips. The color stain lasts a very long time.It's my favorite lip stain!

name: Linda G
review: Lipstick or lipgloss NEVER lasts on me.  While this definitely lasts a lot longer than most for me, it still dissipates and needs to be reapplied after lunch.  It provides a nice base color and blush to the lips, and I really like that it's not drying and glides on with a pleasant slightly waxy feel, sort of like chap stick.  You do need a liner to create definition and adding a lighter color gloss over the top creates a great look! Fantastic value for the price.  I will purchase more of these in different colors

name: jillclare
review: I've tried so many lip stains (including the regular just bitten, tarte's lip stain, and benetint) and this is the only one that has actually stayed put for a whole work day with no need to reapply. The color goes on pretty intense (I bought sweetheart) but fades to a light tint that is perfect and the tint stays put literally all day. I tested it today at work, putting it on at 8pm. I checked it at 5and my lips still have a pink tint. It's not really moisturizing but it doesnt dry out your lips either.  I wear it with a pink gloss because I like a little shine. Amazing and a ggreat buy especially since I've spent much more on ones that didn't last half as long.

name: nanni
review: Was exited to get these in 3 different colors. Looks nice when first applied but is very drying. Also leaves that line on lips shortly after applying. Little disapointed

name: Ash
review: I really really really love this product... personally for me it beats out the similar pricey products out there. The color is long wearing, great color pay off,and the smell is a nice minty fresh scent.The color lasts hours and you dont have to worry much about touching up. Revlon really stepped up to the plate with this product. I own crush and adore and will be purchasing more colors.

name: StudentOnABudget
review: I definitely love this product. I have lovesick, honey, romantic, sweethert, and cherish. They can be sheer but they are buildable so that's a plus. They are pigmented; my lips are very pigmented but I can get the color to show up on my lips if I work it a couple of times over my lips. They are not as moisturizing as I would like, but they aren't too drying. Some of the stains are acutally darker than the actual color; honey and cherish do this. Sweetheart, romantic, and lovesick show their true colors. Sweetheart and lovesick are very similar colors so I would recommend lovesick for a more cool toned color and sweetheart for a more warm toned color. Honey is a good light color for everyday but its stain is a dark magenta, unlike the original pale pink.

name: kaylan
review: love this product, the color payoff is great and they last a very long time!

name: sarah
review: I have about three of these ranging from light pinks to bright and hot pinks and I love them. Doesn't dry out my lips and stains them amazingly. Recommend hands down!

name: Mimorgan
review: I love this product but I'm looking for a matching lip liner for the romantic color does anyone have any suggestions?

name: Sue
review: I have always had trouble getting lipsticks to stay on for any period of time.  This lip stain stays on for a very long time and I no longer have to worry about constantly refreshing my lipstick!  Great product!

name: Bekah
review: I love the color!

name: PC
review: Since the Revlon Matte balms were so good I figured this glossy stain would be, too. SO WRONG. The color application is patch at best. The gloss wears off quickly and though it stains well, since it applies unevenly, the stain is uneven, too. I don't know if I got a bad one or what but I'm afraid to waste money on another one.

name: Ally
review: I really like the light minty smell. It goes on really smooth and lasts for hours!

name: Bombshell Certification
review: I really liked the moisture but the color looked too orange/red on me instead of deep dark sheer wine-- gave it to a friend but would try another color for the sheer moisture look

name: Ally
review: Love this product! Would definitely recommend it!

name: me
review: Use it every day

name: Livia
review: This lip color is vivid and gorgeous. I always get compliments on it. If you build the color it lasts for hours. The Sweetheart shade is stunning. It's a bright pink that leans toward fuchsia. It's truly the only lip color I have that I love so much I wear it without mixing it with another shade. Even though these lip crayons last forever, I bought a backup of this one.

name: Hard-working Woman
review: The product promises long lasting color.  Not true.  I have tried other lip stains that were more effective.  The stain is easy to apply and feels smooth on my lips.

name: mally
review: the balm stain was not pigmented and had little staying power especially for a "stain". for me the overall color and staying power was off but I did like the almost mint floss smell and the creaminess of the balm.

name: mally
review: the balm stain was not pigmented and had little staying power especially for a "stain". for me the overall color and staying power was off but I did like the almost mint floss smell and the creaminess of the balm.

review:
This stuff is great. It smells and tastes amazing, like peppermint. The color lasts really well too. I have trouble getting it off sometimes at night! For even longer lasting power, I use a lip liner underneath it.

The crayon it come in is great too, easy to carry with you, easy to apply. Another hit for revlon!

name: Jessica J
review: Love this color and product. It last longer than a normal lip gloss, but I wouldn't say it has the staying power of a true lip stain. Still enjoy it though!

name: Curls All Night
review: I can't wait to get more colors! I love the packaging, it makes it so easy to put on.

name: carol
review: The color is true to color and the smell is pleasant!

name: DianaWin
review: I really like the lip product. This color was very bright and pigmented, but at the time I couldn't justify the price. I returned it and got a similar product, Jordana. Colors are almost a dupe and half the price.

name: dragonflyjeanne
review: Very moist, but long lasting, great color.

name: Yvonbela
review: Pink

name: Lorna
review: I picked this up in the color Honey. Works really well if worn on top of the Revlon Lip Butters.  Otherwise, it might be too drying.  I also ended up getting this kissable balm stain in the color Crush, which leaves more of a stain on the lip after several hours because of the darker tone.  These balm stains have more of a matte look than glossy.  Convenient twist up pencil packaging, minty smelling, & easy to apply.

name: Haylee
review: I have two of these, one in Smitten(purpley hot pink) and one in Rendezvous(striking orange). They are absolutely beautiful--soft, buttery, pigmented yet a little on the sheer side, but I think that depends on the color you buy. For example, I tried Romantic(red) and it wasn't the mot pigmented and it was very sheer. These do stain well, but I do think they need to be reapplied at least once. They also look nice over other lipsticks. They can be a little sticky, but they're just as sticky as any lip balm. These are an exact dupe for Tarte's Lip Surgence chubby sticks, except there is a smaller variety of colors and finishes. If Revlon came out with a Matte version of these, that would be perfect! Over all, I want almost every color of these in my makeup collection right now (except Romantic. I disliked that color, but if you're looking for a bright sheer red, it's for you.):)

name: felinegirl
review: I chose a brighter color, thinking that it was more sheer.  NOT.  It's not as bad as some others that I've tried for drying, but it definitely dries.  Doesn't stain much.  Wears off in a short time.

name: Kelly
review: The color of the tube is actually a lot darker than the color of the lip stain.  I ended up getting a bright pink when I would have rather had something a bit darker.  Still a great product though.

name: Emily
review: I cannot live without the "Honey" shade. I am addicted to it - perfect MLBB shade.  I also love the lavender one, the deep berry and the wine...but the darker colors require a bit more care. All of them layer gorgeously as a base for other lipsticks, or even on top of some to smooth them out.

name: ysj
review: i use it with Revlon Lip Butter for long lasting, moisturizing wear

review: Im in love with this product ! it's long lasting, smells great like peppermint, when you apply it you get this tingly cooling feeling i own only 4 since there was only 4 colors i loved

review:

review: I use this product as an everyday wear type product. I wish it had more of that mint tingle but even without it I love these balm stains! If you are debating between this and Revlon's new Ultimate Suede get this because ultimate suede dries your lips out within a few minutes of wear.

name: KV22
review: Overall, great concept. i just selected a color that was too light for me.

name: Kelly
review: I love these. I have several colors and they are so easy to carry with me or store at home. They can be drying but using Chapstick over it works just fine.

name: Nanny on the run
review: I love this, I use it all the time. It gives me a little pick me up no matter what I'm off running around doing and I get compliments whenever I wear it out. Great little lip stain except you  must wear a lip liner with it or else it will bleed and you'll look like a hot mess!

name: Sabrina
review: I bought this in Honey just to try it (I'm not really a lip product girl) and I really like it. It doesn't dry out my lips and gives a nice hint of color that lasts a long time.

name: Julie
review: I have the color rendezvous. I love the color and it smells like mint. Exfoliate your lips before use because the color will settle into creases and cracks. Color does come off onto clothes and napkins, etc. So while the color does stay a long time, it is more of a balm than a stain.

name: Amber
review: Colors are great, but wears off very easily.

name: Sammy
review: It smells minty and twists up so no need for sharpening

name: Mommy
review: If you like your lips to have sone color long after your lipstick wears off.... This is the stuff for you! This is a product I thought about stocking up on for fear it will be discontinued!

review: I bought the 'cherish devotion' color thinking it would be a light pink.  Although it turned out to be a  bright, almost fluorescent pink color, I have gotten so many compliments on it that it is now my new favorite shade.  Never thought I would be able to wear this color as a redhead either :)

name: Brookie
review: Glides on like a gloss although looks like a pencil. Nice minty taste and smell.  However, when I see "stain" I think the product is going to leave a color on my lips.  This product doesn't; it wears off leaving no residual color rather quickly. Pretty colors.

name: Meow
review: Love this product! It applies evenly and moisturizes well with a nice minty tingle. This color is especially perfect for everyday use. Can't wait to get more colors!

name: Tori
review: use daily and very nice texture on lips also moisturizing

name: Risa
review: I have been searching for a perfect lipstain but many are around $20, these ones are great and you can usually use coupons or its buy one get one 50% off. I bought 3! I love them all, in adore, smitten and crush. Crush was definitely more of a darker fuschia/burgundy color but if you do one swipe its lighter, almost like smitten. Smitten I've been wearing every day since its lighter for daytime and adore I just got, which is more red. I wish they had more nuetral pink colors and less vibrant colors since when I tried Charm I didn't like the nude, plus for me I feel the point of a lipstain is for the colors! These last all day and after eating the shine goes away so its matte, but still looks good, add a clear gloss and your good to go again! Only gave 4 stars because I do wish they had more reds, peaches and neutral tones.

name: Mel
review: Nice but wears off easily

name: xxstellarxx
review: This is a very pretty hot pink color that I think would compliment any skin tone. I am latina with medium/olive skin tones and it suites me well. This product has a very even glossy finish. Although the gloss does wear off after a while, you are left with a very nice stain of color on your lips that is not overpowering and is great for everyday use. I cant wait to try the other colors!I give it 4 stars only because I would have loved for the gloss to last longer...

name: Busy mom of three
review: Was looking for an alternative to Clinique Chubby Sticks....this works great at a fraction of the cost of Clinique plus they taste good.  Not long lasting but I can live with that.  I will be back to buy one in each color.

review: Not worth the money. Didn't stay on as long as I thought it would and it wasn't very moisturizing.

review: It nice but doesn't last for "hours". However, it does leave a hint of a tint of color once it wears off.

review: I used the product everyday trying to see if more of the color would pop out on my lips but it didn't which was disappointing. it's more of a slightly colored chapstick, which i have plenty of. I just wish it was true to its color.

name: Jenn
review: Really like it.

name: Carolthecatlover

It is very natural looking but I still feel like I am wearing some color on my lips.  One concern I have about this product is when it starts to wear down-do you have to purchase a sharpener?  It is very easy to apply

name: Meg
review: I love how the packaging is. However, the shade honey might as well be a clear gloss for me though.

name: shayshay
review: I have all the colors except charm,precious, and cherish. This product is addictive because of the range of colors and long lasting stain, you will want to buy more. My favorite colors are smitten, crush,and honey.

name: klnh
review: These did not disappoint. They are very pigmented and are extremely moisturizing. I love them and purchased quite a few in two days.

name: Bikkie
review: I bought two based on other's recommendations and am satisfied with them.  The colors are too close together in tone but that was my fault. They have enough of a point that you can line your lips before filling them in - a plus.  I don't think they are as long lasting as other brands but the scent and texture are better than some.  They don't dry out my lips as much as others.

name: lostseaurchin
review: Balm-like texture with smooth just-right thickness. Crayon is very hard so takes a bit of layering for complete application. The balm part wears off like any balm and some color is left, but not as much as I would have liked. I have had better stain results from other products. I may try layering this one over a pure stain.

name: Meg
review: I have the colors Honey and Sweetheart. Honey tends to change color over time, from a brownish pink to a brighter pink. Sweetheart is very bright in person, too bright for my taste and unsuitable for my yellow undertones. It does however, look good if applied with a light hand on top of another lip product, like a gloss or another lipstick. The color Sweetheart will probably look better on cooler skin tones while Honey is a versatile color, or at least until the color changes. These colors do apply evenly and have a pleasant light minty scent. The lasting power in this lipstick is good, however, it is not phenomenal. As long as the balm texture is still on your lips, the color will transfer to whatever your lips touch. Once the balm component wears off, and you'll know this when it feels like there is no product on your lips, the color does not transfer (unless you rub really hard with a napkin). Make sure your lips are not chapped before you put this on because the results will not be pretty!

name: DrugstoreDiva
review: Great product,  goes on smooth, great minty smell/taste. Colors are hard to tell by looking at them until they are applied on the lips. Otherwise it is my favorite lip tint/stain

name: Meghannlynne
review: You should know that I was looking for something exactly like the Clinique chubby stick- glossy, not waxy, but buttery with some staying power. I love colored lips, but I cannot STAND it if any dry lip skin or cracks are visible. (Just like every other female on the planet.)Well. this is basically a lipstick. Waxy, none too moisturizing, and it has a shimmery tone that I personally don't like, but that's just personal preference. On the plus side, there's a ton of product that comes in that little tube. I returned the one I didn't open and went back to my clinique chubbys. I'd also reccommend Burts Bees tinted lip balm. Sorry, revlon :/ you didn't cut the mustard this time.

name: Alice
review: I LOVE this lipstick. It's super creamy and it's really easy to apply. I own it in cherish and the shade is beautiful

name: Meg E
review: I use this several times a day. The color is great and would definitely recommend

name: Mamie
review: I love this color. It is pretty much the perfect MLBB (my lips but better).

name: crackedmyself
review: I tried this on recommendation from a friend, and I adore it! I'm constantly drinking water and never thinking to reapply lipstick, so I love that it stains my lips. I can just absentmindedly apply lip balm over it, and it looks like a fresh coat. I also like that it smells minty. I have fair skin and blue eyes, and I use Honey. It's a very natural-looking shade that leaves a darker pink stain.

name: Sarah
review: I bought this in Amore and Honey. Overall it is a great product but I just HATE how waxy and sticky it feels on the lips. The matte balms feel much more comfy on the lips and are more opaque if you are looking for better color payoff. I also don't notice any staining effect even after wearing it all day. It all depends on the color of your lips and your preference I guess.

name: Sue
review: I use this product every day for work and when I go out of an evening.  Last a long time and gives you lasting color a lot longer than typical lipstick.

name: Lipstick lover
review: The perfect lip stain. Still moisturizing because it's technically a "balm stain". But the color is so vibrant!!

name: Jenn
review: I love this lip stick but when i bought it, it was not what i was expecting every indicator pointed to a light nude pink but turned out to be a rosy pink but i still love it

review: Nice balance between lasting color and moisturizing balm.  Color stain maintains and builds up with each application but the moisturizing ability of the balm wears off and eventually the stain dries out lips.

review: Always love this color this is my third time I have bought this hope they never get rid of also lasts long

I have Cherish which is a fun cool pink, Honey which is my own lip color but better, and Rendezvous which is a punchy orange/coral for Summertime.  Love this stuff, it's my fave formulation for lips I've ever found (and i'm a total product junkie).

name: Kier
review: This product is amazing! It's such a nice natural color and the best part is how moisturizing!

name: Ch
review: I don't like heavy lipstick so this gives me the right amount of long lasting color with a lighter feel. I also like the more neutral colors offered.

review: I use this everyday now since I purchased it and it really lasts!  It's not coming off on everything and looks great 6 hours later.

name: KatieL
review:
I got these in 3 colors: Honey, Romantic, and Sweetheart.

Honey and Romantic are my favorites. They have glossy finishes but when I don't want the glossy part I just blot my lips with a napkin and the color looks more natural and just like lipstain.

However, the Sweetheart is just too bright and neon-y for me to use on a daily basis or at all. It just doesn't match my skin tone (south east asian, medium skin tone)

I wouldn't say that the product lasts very long or moisturizes but it's decent. The colors of the sticks aren't exactly true to the actual colors of the product but I just got lucky.

name: Amy
review: This is a nice shear look if you don't feel like going for the full lipstick look. I really hate lip gloss so this is a great alternative for me! I bought one of these, then went back and bought two more!

name: Debbie
review: I really like this product. I use it everyday!  I only wish it would stay on longer.

name: Marie J
review: Daily for color for my pale lips! I hate lip gloss and lipstick so this is the best product I e found for color!

name: Lin D.
review: Color applies easily, stays on longer than most I've tried, reasonably priced and doesnt dry my lips

name: Sevonna
review: This is my holy grail product, I don't leave the house without it! ♥

name: Kitkat
review: I got the Revlon balm stain in the color honey and I love it. It's the perfect my lips but better shade and it's a stain so it lasts awhile. Since I got it I have been obsessed with it. Its Ben a staple in my purse.

name: IMPRESSED
review: This is the best product ever! When I want a color that lasts all day I go straight to this product. I have only used the shade 001 Honey, which looks great on everyone. The application is glossy at first and appears a bit dark, but eventually it changes to a nice, natural pop of pink. The color can last about 5-6 hours without touch-ups. Unlike most lip stains, the Revlon Just Bitten Lip Stain is very moisturizing. *One quick tip- the product can bleed a bit if you are not careful with application- ESPECIALLY in hot weather.

name: Iris
review: love the color, long lasting. I've never used an entire lipstick but this!

name: cindymae
review: Nice natural color that only lightly stains and doesn't last too long. I top it with a lip gloss for evening for a little more sparkle.

name: Jeanine
review: It's a little more expensive than I usually purchase, but because it stays on and has a nice, finished look, it's worth it.

I have this color and the Crush color and love both of them.  a

review: This color is perfect ! It gives just the right amount of pink !

name: Sel
review: Love it.  I use it for work and it tingles and doesn't smudge.

name: KJ

This is hands down the best lip stain I've ever worn. Usually, lip stains are so drying, but the balm in this really made a difference. There was no lack of color, either. review: Very much like Clinique's chubby stick but not as moisturizing but it lasts longer. The only problem is that the color does not match with what is being portrayed in the container.

I would suggest to apply generously and then when it begins to fade apply some tinted, moisturizing gloss.

name: Dani

name: Dazzling Denise
review: I love how this product goes on and stays on and the balm keeps my lips smooth which causes me to put on less chapstick.

name: Lee The Great
review: Super moisturizing and beautiful colors .

name: Texas Girl
review: Color Stay Kissable Balm Stain is a "knock off" of the Clinque Chubby,  but I have to say that I think I like it better, especially for the price.   The color is long lasting, sheer, and lightweight.

Might be great if you were dressing up as Minaj for Hallloween?,

name: BLKR1991
review: This is a great product, it has a great stain effect that lasts all day. The balm wears off a little quick for my taste but the color is still there even after the balm is gone, all you have to do is reapply it to remoisterize your lips. This stuff is great.

name: Becca
review: This is the second time I have bought this shade. I love it!

name: Maria
review:
I love the color, very light pink, kind of nude pink... it is easy to apply it even with no mirror :) am glad I bought it and it was on great price...

review: I loved the color and the ease of use. The only thing that I am not completely satisfied with is that it doesn't stay like a stain usually does!

name: People Mcnugget
review: Want one in every color, love the hint of Mint

name: karlyoh
review:
After hearing several good reviews on youtube about this lipstain, I decided to purchase one and give it a try. The color that I bought is Honey. My lips have color but not so much that it looks garrish next to my pale skin.

I apply this lipstain in the morning before I leave for work. The color lasts through several cups of coffee, breakfast, and lunch before it starts to fade. I reapply mid-day and I'm good until I get home.

I am glad that I gave this product a try. I will be buying more colors for myself and my daughters.

name: Megan
review: Easy to apply. Pigmentation was great, very even. Lasts a long time (unless you eat food with oil), color stays even after the glossiness has worn off, so I put Chapstick over it and still have great color. Feels smooth on my lips. Find your favorite color and you can't go wrong!

name: kat

name: lmevans
review: I purchased this in Romantic and I absolutely LOVE it! I love lip color that doesn't take a primer, a brush, and a half an hour to apply. While it isn't as long-lasting as most lip stains, it is very moisturizing and it wears evenly (no more ring around the lips by mid-afternoon)! I'm sold.

name: Lia
review: I love them!!!I have almost all the colors and I can't get enough of them :)

name: Steph
review: Love love it in honey!

name: Bizbis
review: I do not have sensitive skin and the stain made my lips sting until I removed it 10 min later.

name: Yare
review: I use the lighter colors during the day and it's simple to just put it on and walk out of the door just an amazing product!

name: CaliGerl
review: These are awesome! I got the shade "precious" and it's a perfect nude shade and these really stain your lips! They also do NOT dry your lips out. LOVE! Will be buying more shades!

name: colorlover
review: FINALLY! A cosmetics company got a lipstain right. These are so great. I have tried every lip stain imaginable from CG Outlast to expensive Tarte and Lorac. This Revlon Colorstain Balm Stain is the best I've used. It slides on like a gloss crayon, lips feel smooth and mositurized. Then, after a minute or less, the glossy color sets into a great stain and it does not come off even after you put another gloss on top. Lips stayed colored for 6+ hours even through drinks and dinner. I wear the Crush shade which is a summery berry shade - so pretty. I will never go back to those felt pen or messy stain in a nailpolish-type bottle lip stains anymore - my new favorite product is this Revlon balm stain crayon! Anyone who has used other stains or long wearing stain lipsticks, you will love these balm sticks. A whole new level and the feel is so much nicer.

name: sophy
review: These are so long lasting and beautiful. Definitely recommend.

name: Duskenight
review: I use it quite frequently and I love it!  The slightly minty flavor/scent is awesome too. the selection of colors available make it perfect for all occasions ie: weddings, everyday wear, other formal occasions.  there are no problems with this product for me.

name: AnnieCif
review: I have tried this product a few times, however I am not happy. When I purchase a "Lip Balm" I expect it to moisturize my lips and make them look lucious. This "balm" accentuates the appearance of dry cracked lips.

name: Jen
review: I bought a Revlon Just Bitten Kissable Balm Stain in Smitten yesterday and fell in love with it!!! It works SO MUCH BETTER than any lipstain I've ever tried. It hydrates AND has awesome staying power. I applied it 1 hour before lunch and did not have to reapply the color for the rest of my day. I love it so much that I went to buy another one in Crush today!!! I did a lot of research before purchasing this produt, online and personal experience, and this Balm/Stain wins hands down in comparison to the rest.

name: starkitty526
review: First - I have lips that are prone to drying and a slightly strange skin tone, so I consider myself to be VERY picky (especially about lip products, as everything seems to pink on me and my skin is olive - not the best combo...).  I have light olive skin, so I tend to look best in true neutral shades - not leaning toward orange or blue tones, but dusty pinks, brick reds, some peach-tinted pinks...  At first, I was really skeptical about the color selection.  The first color I got was Sweetheart, thinking it would be a good slightly peachy summery pink.  It's not.  :(  It's very bright, definitely summery.  The initial color is a bit shocking, but it fades into the lips after a few minutes, so after the initial shock, it actually faded into a nice flush of color that will be nice for summer (If I can get used to the fact that it's not a color that I would normally wear).  It does have some blue in it - it's very much a Barbie pink - but it will be good for the season, I'm just not sure I'll actually be reaching for it on a regular basis.  Now for the good part of the review - I loved the texture and the wear of the product so much, that I actually researched the colors and went back to get a couple more that I would actually want to wear more often.  I ended up with Honey and Adore.  In all of the swatches, Honey looks very neutral and brownish, but on me it's actually this really great slightly rose nude color.  Extremely wearable, and oddly long-lasting.  I put it on last night and, after 4 hours of wear (including eating and drinking - both cold and hot beverages), then removing my makeup, there was still a slight flush of color on my lips when I woke up this morning.  WOW!  When I put it on, I remember thinking it wasn't super-pigmented, but that should tell you how natural-looking this color is, since it was still detectable in the morning.  As someone who can't pull off a truly nude lip (with my skin tone, it makes me look like a corpse), this natural lip look will be great with any makeup look.  The other color, Adore, is pretty true to the packaging color.  It's a reddish wine color, but it has some brown in it, so it doesn't run too cool. I consider it to be a very wearable red-tone, but it's not garish or shocking like a true red or a coral red can be.  I really like the minty taste, and it actually has a balmy feel.  The balmy feel does wear off after awhile, but it's not as bad as a regular stain.  This formulation does not seem to be drying, either, even after you wear it for several hours.  The one word of caution I would say (for all 3 colors) is that the color is very buildable and, as this is a stain, if you put a ton on and it ends up being too bright, you will be somewhat stuck with the result for awhile.  The only thing that cost this product a star is that there's no SPF protection in it.  That would have made it truly perfect - especially heading into summer.  Overall, I think these are great.  One of the best new lip products out there.  Get them while they're on sale and grab them when you see them, they're going fast!

If you are going for a subtle everyday look, apply it lightly around the lips and rub them together. I find that I usually top it off with a gloss of some sort to give it a glossy finnish.

review: I have the color in Romantic and I do love it! I wish I could buy more. Nice minty scent, strong red color, and the stain does last quite a while. review: This is an excellent product.  My friends have even asked for the brand name after seeing it.  I will continue to purchase this product.

review: I don't know how there can even be negative comments on this lip product! I own hundreds of different lip products, and no matter how high-end a lipstick can be I always come back to these baby's. I love them oh so much! The color stays on for so long. The COLOR selection is amazing.. If you have dry lips it's best to apply balm 30 mins. before applying this. For someone who is pretty  light complected I always get compliments with the variety of colors I wear from these, and even when the balm wears off I still have that vibrant color. review: The color doesn't stay and it is more sparkly than I expected.  it does have a good gloss to it.  I would recomend the product for the gloss factor, but maybe a different color?

review: I have this product in sweetheart, charm, AND cherish. They are very moisturizing and the color is great. Charm is my go to nude- looks good for everyday. review: I love this stuff! The first one I purchased was Lovesick and I wanted something a little lighter so I purchaser Cherish (perfection!) it goes on like butter and it doesn't have that sticky lipgloss feel. However, it does have to be reapplied but I would still recommend it.

name: beautycutie101
review: Now I bought this in the color 025 Sweetheart Valentine. It is very pink and pigmented. You  can build on the color very easily. The shade is however, way to pink and bright for me. I like natural and lighter pink or peaches. I am going back to Ulta to purchase it in the Honey color. I was able to bring down the intensity of the color by smudging my lips with a paper towel right after I out it on and before it dried. It is not moisturizing but not drying. I do apply a gloss/chap stick over it. You do not need much to cover all your lips and it will last you forever. it lasts a very long time. It has lasted through two meals, several glasses of water, my scrubbing it off, and dozens of applications of gloss and chap sticks because I love applying them and it is long lasting. I was slightly disappointed that it did not come with a chap stick end like the marker version does. I think it's just because the marker on was very drying I hear. The concept is nice, but I can not believe how few color choices were. These are ideal for summer looks, perfect for water parks, the beach. But the colors are much more winter and night shades for my taste. I do not hate this color, but I do need to smudge it out and sometimes a very sheer nude gloss or lipstick over it for some days. It's mostly personal opinion. Absolutely no sparkle so that's something I like. It does not smell bad, but it resembles other Revlon lip products. Not as unpleasant as many other  lip stains I have used before.

name: Kat
review: Initial shine, stains evenly, reapply to moisturize and add color

name: Shan
review: I loved this product. I learned about it on youtube and fell in love with it. Plus I was able to use the coupons and Buy 2, get one free deals. Aside from all of the good deals this is a product that I recommend.

name: Dani A
review: The Kissable Balm Stains are super products. The stains go one easily and are super moisturizing with an initially glossy finish that fades to a matte stain. The minty smell is also nice while not being overpowering. The exterior tubes are NOT true to color so I suggest looking at online reviews and swatches before investing in one. So far, I own three - Precious (sheer nude), Sweetheart (bright pink) and Lovestruck (bright fuscia). While Sweetheart is initially a very  sheer nude the stain does not last. With Sweetheart and Lovestruck, however, they last for hours. I've made it through dinner, drinks and a full night of sleep and still had stain on in the morning. They fade evenly and come off easily in the shower. I've heard several people say they even prefer these to Tarte's equivalnet (several times the price of these!). Honestly worth a shot. You'll fall in love.

review: I have these in smitten and sweetheart and I absolutely love them!  I am a very dry person and while these do dry my lips out a bit, it is the least drying stain I've ever used.  The chubby crayon applicator makes it so easy to apply, it goes on evenly, and lasts all day! The only negative would be the scent.  It smells like peppermint. I hate peppermint but luckily after its applied the smell goes away so I only suffer for a minute or two while applying.  The beautiful color and long lasting wear definitely make up for the gross smell.

review: Long Lasting without drying  finally found a product that will stay put  and still have a soft glossy finish

name: Pandabear

name: ebuckles
review: I love this lip color. It's very natural, good for every day use, and easy to apply. I usually put some chapstick on underneath it to moisturize my lips a little before putting it on because it can be kind of drying.

name: Tina
review: I use this all day and even put it on before working out to keep my lips moisturized.  I also like the long holder since it's easier to hold and find in my purse even if at the bottom :) I bought this neutral color just to try the product and now look forward to buying others colors.

The minty feel threw me off at first, but it doesn't last long. I'm fair skinned with yellow and pink undertones, medium brown hair, green eyes. I went for Cherish for a cool pink tone, and Smitten for a brighter color (this shade makes my teeth look whiter). Will be adding Honey and Sweetheart to my collection soon so I have a range of options! I usually have maybe two or three lip colors TOTAL on hand, so it's unusual for me to be excited about purchasing a whole color range of one product!

name: Jacmit
review: I like that I apply it in the morning and don't have to reapply all day.  Gives my lips a nice subtle amount of effortless color.

name: swebbz
review: I bought this Revlon balm stain in Sweetheart. I really like the color, it's a pretty pink, but not overwhelming. One thing to note is that the color on the stick won't immediately show up as is on your lips, it takes a few minutes to develop into the right shade, just be patient. It does last a long time, but the brightness fades if you eat, drink, etc. I love it because my boyfriend actually kisses me with it on, whereas lipstick comes off and lip gloss feels sticky to him. This balm stain is smooth, almost like chapstick. I am looking forward to buying more colors to try!

name: Voluptuous Brenda
review: I usually use this product when I'm tryna go for a natural look. It has a subtle colour  and just enough gloss to make the lip stand out, but not to the point where it's like "yeah dude you're totally wearing lip gloss" I like how long it is and how convenient it is to apply this.

review: I love this product. I have long been a fan of lip balms and butters and the Revlon Colorburst Balm Stain is my new favorite. I purchased it in Romantic and Lovesick and I was thrilled with the beautiful color payoff. Whether you opt for sheer or opaque coverage, it wears really well because it is a stain. That's what makes it the perfect balm. I will absolutely purchase more of these balms.

name: AshNB
review:
I own this product in several colors, with "honey" being my day to day choice for work. I find that this shade is just a more vibrant shade of my natural lip, but this adds sheen. This product is not drying like other lip stains with a felt tip marker package.

Color lasts long if you let it set a bit before messing with your lips in anyway.

I will continue to purchase as long as this product is offered.

review: I have the color Honey, and it is perfect for an everyday naturally rosy lip color. For a balm, I wish it was more hydrating. It is, however, a wonderful, evenly applicated stain that holds color for a good amount of time.

review: Decided to pick up another Revlon Just Bitten Lip Balm. I went with Cherish. I was hesitant about how the color would apply but it was true to color & applied smoothly & evenly. I am a total fan. Definitely a repurchase.

name: Hfrob
review: This is such an awesome product for anyone wanting to begin using a colored lip product without having to worry about it rubbing off or getting on your boyfriend or difficult brush application. No need for a liner, lipstick, and gloss. This is the perfect product and it feels like chapstick but looks fabulous! So comfortable and yet so edgy!

name: Honey
review: I use this product almost daily and really like the fact that it is long lasting and moisturizing at the same time.

name: Blonde purse lady
review: I put this product on in the morning and it usually still looks pretty good several hours in to the day as long as I haven't eaten. I can still drink and it stays put.  It's small enough to keep in your pocket and re-apply later in the day or after a meal if necessary. I'll probably go and purchase more colors I like this product so much. It's a bit drying, so keep a chapstick with you to lubricate your lips every now and then. Not bad though for a stain. I really like this product & it's a great price.

name: Natural Beauty
review: I really love these lip products; I have honey, cherish, and lovesick and they are all great colors. When I first apply them, the balm is moisturizing and it is shiney, and after an hour or so the dry down color is still there and keeps your lips a nice pinkish tint. I love the light minty scent. I diagree that they are drying, bc when initially put on they are moisturizing like a balm, but even lip balms wear out after a while and have to be reapplied. It starts out as a balm and stains the lips; so the stain stays, but I would recommend applying regular lip balm after a few hours, bc the color will still be there, the balm-y feeling will not. Overall, I love this prouduct, will be purchasing more in the future, and wish they had more colors!!!

name: Denisse
review: Love the fact that it stays on for a long time.

name: L
review:
I had high hope for a moisturizing stain. This is not it, but it's good.
I want moisturizing, but this is pretty dry. However, it goes on like lip liner, with similar coverage but in a larger crayon instead of a thin line, and it is definitely more moist than lip liner.
I also want a stain, something that will color my lips for hours. This wears off nearly as quickly as regular lipstick.
I got the Honey. The packaging makes it look very pink, but I took a chance and found it to be more subdued and neutral - perfect for the everyday wear I wanted.
Overall, I like it and may try it in other colors, but it was not what I was hoping for.

review: These are great balm stains. So happy revlon came out with these after the first stains that had the felt tip on one end and the clear balm on the other. Those were terrible. These are very pigmented and stay a good amount of time. Some color wears off but does leave a stain especially the brighter/deeper shades. Wish they would come out with more/new shades for this line. I know there are matte/lacquer ones now but still like these best because are not matte but not super shiny!

name: Chicky67
review: I really like this product.  Unfortunately it doesn't last as long as you would think but it does lasts as long as lipstick.  The colors are bright so you may want to consider that when picking  your shade.

name: Liza
review: I love this product! I purchased it in another color too. This product is really my go to lipstain because it lasts long and keeps my lips feeling moist. It is also great to wear when you are at work just because it stays on for so long!

name: Julie
review: It wore off quickly except left a lipliner look.

name: Digital Diva
review: Great product I have recommended it to several of my friends and coworkers

name: Drana
review:
So beautiful! This is the first lip stain that i have tried that actually STAINS my lips. I have tried out multiple shades from tge covergirl outlast collection, and although the color looked nice at the beggining of the day, i hated the dry formulation as well as the lasting power of the product. Within one hour, the 'stain' would have almost entirely faded, but worse than that, it often would leave splotchy coloration in the fine lines of my lips.
This product looks lovely when you first apply it, and lasts significantly longer than the stain by covergirl. My favorite part though is that it fades to a very even, natural look, so that you arent left looking like a hot mess. It also has a slight moisurizing quality to it, and is much easier to apply then dry formula lip stains. I purchased the color Lovesick, and find that it is very versitile and buildable, allowing for you to achieve both bold and natural looks.

name: Jenn
review: Overall I really love these. I think the lip stain aspect of this product is great... until it begins to wear off. I always end up with what I call the "red ring of death" around my mouth because it's the only part of the stain that never fades away and I'm not sure if that's my fault or the product's fault.

name: Vc
review: I am outside a lot in my line of work.  Lipsticks and stains do not stay on and tend to bleed below the lip line. Wish I could find something that works.

name: Chick George
review: I tried this because I didn't want to spend $17+ for the Tarte version (which is amazing!) I LOVE this Revlon version, a great everyday product for 1/2 the price. The fresh minty taste and smell plus the light feel are the two best things about it. Of course it is a stain which is super and it lasts a long time without drying like the other stains I've tried. It also can be dual purpose lipstick / gloss, just layer it.

review: I've bought five of these - I generally try to go with a shade of lip gloss just slightly darker than my lips, just to accent my natural color, not to look "made up".  But every one of these is so harsh, or so fake looking.... the colors look completely different on me than they do in the applicator.  I wish there was a way I could try them on before buying them!

review: I like this product. I really do, but if your lips aren't moisturized before hand you're going to get a clumpy application. That's the biggest problem I have with this. name: Natural nurse
review: I'm a nurse and avoid lipstick because it can be drying, touch up is a hassle, and don't want to look sexy at work. I got more compliments this week wearing it and it's as easy as chapstick, can't live without it now! A very natural look.

name: Doreen the Cat
review: It is perfect to use all the time when you need a little color or alot.

name: StudentOnABudget
review: I definitely love this product! I have almost all of the colors...only waiting for the other colors to come in stock to grab them too ;) I love that they're super pigmented and if you give them a bit of time (about 15-20 minutes) they'll completely set for the whole day! I went to a party with these and ate and drank a lot but no color came off but my lips looked as it did when I first appllied them (giving ample time for the color to set). The stain that the darker colors leave behind are true to color however the lighter ones like honey, became a fuschia/magenta on my lips (may be because i got a defective-ish one or my lips are pigmented?) However, I still love these! When you first apply, they are moisturizing but when the balm wears off I recommend having a balm handy to keep them moisturized unless you want to reapply the balmstain again. I do not recommend applying these to chapped lips because it will cause uneveness and looks reallly weird. They also have a weird minty smell...I usually love minty smells but this one is a little unpleasant. However, the smell does not stick around once it;s on your lips.

name: River
review: I am very regretted to spent money and time to try this product.  I should not believed what I read on the magazine.

name: Supertech
review: I expected more of a stain, but all in all, a good chubby I will continue to use.

name: Tangled
review: I have this product in Honey and Smitten. Honey is perfect for everyday and smitten is an amazing pop of pink for special occasions! I really love how long this lasts. It really does stain your lips for a long time - especially the darker color. I highly recommend this product!

name: Ellie
review: I love the Tarte lipsurgence lip tints and heard how these Revlon Just Kissable lip stains were very similar to them, so I went and bought 3 of them!! They took forever to ship to my house due to the Christmas holiday and New Years.  This review is for the Smitten color. I received the product brand new, and wrapped up in plastic packaging, but when I removed the cap, I found fingerprints inside!! It was gross!! I was a bit disappointed. They were definitely not from me, and I had to wipe it w/ a tissue to get rid of them, which wiped off a bit of lip product :( The other two lip balms were clean and brand new though (no fingerprints).  However, the product's overall performance was great; it was moisturizing even without reapplying lip balm, had a bit of staining power, and the color was very pretty, a berry-pinkish color. The color does tend to change slightly as the lip color wears off on your lips. It has a nice minty smell and feeling on your lips, which goes away after a minute. Smitten can be worn during the day and for going out, depending on how much you apply on your lips. I would have given it a 5-star rating if there hadn't been the nasty finger prints inside!! Always check your lip products before applying them on your lips, even if they are brand new!!

name: Looking for a moisture lipstain
review: This lipstain does not hold up as long as it says. The color samples are not true to the real color in the tube.  I went back to using inexpensive mood lipsticks that last longer and soften my lips too.

name: Robin
review: Good product, easy to put on.

name: No time to fuss
review: It is so easy to apply while driving. I don't like to bother with  lip liner.  This product is easy to place right where you want it.

name: Plinkinat
review:
I LOVE these. So far I have been through almost one each of the Honey and Rendezvous. I keep one of each with my makeup at home and one of each in my purse. The honey is for cool days and the Rendezvous is for peachy days. These two colors are fool-proof in application. You slap them on like lip balm and swipe down your filtrum and you're good to go. They have a slight sheen like lip balm and make your lips look soft and moist but not glossy. Both are beautiful soft colors that are only slightly darker than most natural lip tones. With the Honey it looks like my natural lips, but better and the color lasts and isn't as drying as most stains. I end up reapplying, not for color but to keep my lips from getting chapped from the winter weather.

The Smitten and Crush are not as wearable for me, at work, but would be great for going out. In fact, most of the colors just don't seem wearable on a daily basis. However, I'm totally happy with the two colors that I'm using constantly and have have bought an extra of Honey and will continue to stock up when it's on sale. I would hate for them to discontinue this product. I was using the liquid Just Bitten before they came out with this and thought I was fine with it. This product is so much better that I wouldn't want to go back. The tube lasts soooooo much longer than the liquid too. I could go through a pen in several weeks and I've been working on the balms for months and am not out.

name: jessepinkmanyo
review: I love these lip stains and have since they came out they will always be my staple. the shade smitten is my favorite because it gives me a pretty pink stain and just looks so nice and girly. I really love the rest of the shades too and I love that they leave me a natural looking stain behind. I wish I could give them ten Stars!

name: Bootiful129
review: Goes on creamy with color that lasts. Doesn't feel dry.

name: curlyq191
review: I love this lip stick.  It isn't too dry and it has good staying power.

name: Cameron
review: I apply when going out and when lips are dry.

name: LALALiz
review: I've had this product in the color Honey for some time now, and I've never fully loved it. I find it drying after a time, it doesn't last very long and needs reapplication. But I wore it when I was out all day at the Renaissance Fair and when I looked in a mirror towards the end of the day I saw it had stained my lips (especially on the drier areas) a weird neon bright salmon color. NOTHING like the soft mauve-pink of the product. I was pretty embarassed, and since it was the only product I had with me I had to reapply to try to cover up the weirdness! Next time I'll just stick to Chapstick!

name: Sol
review: Too much of a creamy application not the color of what it looks like outside needed to apply several times

name: Chloe
review: I love these balm stains! I have 2 colors and I want to buy more! They are so comfortable on the lips, it just feels like you're wearing a chapstick. The smell is great if you love mint.

name: HeathMaiden
review:
My biggest complaint about the Romantic (red) shade is that it's ever so slightly more on the orange side of red than the wine/berry side. The container led me to believe it would be more the latter, but it turns out it's more the former. (I would argue the above picture offers the same color misrepresentation. It is not as deep a shade as you see above.) For this reason, I really don't like wearing this by itself.

I get the best results when I wear this over a berry red marker lip stain. Between the two products, my lips are a red I love, and they remain red all day. Even with eating and drinking and only applying colorless lip balm throughout the day, I find my lips still have noticeable tint 10-12 hours later.

I think the product itself is a good one, but I have some serious misgivings about the color represented. I strongly recommend testing before you buy.

name: BEST STAIN WINNER
review: I started using traditional stains over 13 years ago, (back then only stila and smashbox sold stains).  The liquid formulas w/ doe foot applicators of days past lasted a long time, but they were drying and irritated my lips if I used them daily.  (UGH)  I found these AMAZING balm stains several years ago and have not looked back.  The brighter, darker colors of this line stain your lips best.  Some of the colors look different on your lips than on the exterior, (so buy from Ulta so you can exchange if you don't like a color!).  HOW I USE TO GET THE BEST EFFECT:  I draw the color onto my lips, carefully tracing the edges to make them look fuller.  I let the color sit for about 30 minutes.  I then use a tissue to blot off excess color, (press to blot, don't rub) .  I do this two to three times, or until I reach my desired intensity.  This super easy process mutes the color to a WEARABLE intensity and leaves a gorgeous natural flush of color on my lips.  LOVE, LOVE LOVE!  Just with they would come back out with a few more shades in the deeper colors.

name: Megan
review: Ugh I have bought a few of these and I wish I hadn't.  I love lip stains but these first of all have a nasty artificial peppermint sort of taste/smell that I personally do not like.  Second the color never looks on your lips like the product appears when you look at it, both of the colors I bought were way brighter and more garish on my lips than I thought they would be.  As far as it being a stain I don't feel the color lasts as long as a traditional lip stain sort of product.

The only other issue I had was with the slightly sweet minty flavor. I'm not fond of minty lip products - it makes me feel like I've got toothpaste drool on my face. But it's not overwhelming and fades after application.

review: I love this stuff. It is a good color for my skin, does not wear off, does not make my lips feel dry and the color doen't settle into cracks I may have on my lips.

review: I LOVE this line, they are my favorite long lasting lipcolors! But Sweetheart, Crush, Romantic, and smitten are amazing.

name: abnurse
review: I use this product multiple times throughout the day, when needed. The color does a good job of staining for a shorter period of time (think a few hours) so when you're in need of a touch-up for the glossy-effect, you're not darkening the stain too intensely.

review: Was happy when I applied and wore it, but got home at the end of the evening after it wore off and had bright fuscia lips (with a nude initial color). I am embarrassed to think I looked like a Raggedy Ann doll while out. Rather than wearing the color, the color wore me. Won't try again.

review: You don't have to sharpen the lipstick, it's quick and easy to apply, easy to find in a purse, has a lip gloss feel without everything sticking to the container and it's a reasonable price.It would be nice to see if one half the size would work just as well.

name: b
review: I liked as doesn't cake on lips and the color actually stayed on for a reasonable amount of time.  I usually use much more expensive brands and found this to be a just as good if not better.

name: Kari
review: I love these stains.  They're easy to use, long wearing and feel nice on my lips.  I own this stain in four colors - honey, rendevous, lovesick and darling.  Generally lip colors intimidate me but I find all of these colors to be wearable.  The only color I have trouble with is rendevous because it's a coral color and I think it empahisizes how yellow my teeth are.  If you can't decide I would highly recommend the color honey to anyone.

review: This is by far my favorite lip product ever. Once, I splurged on a Tarte LipSurgence and loved it - this is so similar but MUCH more affordable. I love the little hint of mint, and the color lasts really REALLY well. I got it in Honey, and it's so great, I want to get all the colors! Love.

review: I completely love this and currently own 4. I can;t get enough.

review: I wear this to school everyday and it's pretty amazing! The color doesn't make me look fake and it's not too bright. It's also very moisturizing and I have extremely dry skin. All extremely wearable and not too flashy.

name: NYStyle
review: This is a really inexpensive cream stain that really works.  Better yet, it is creamy and not drying to the lips like some other stains are.  My regular lip product costs $65 and this performs better - I have purchased almost every color.

review: Have another color in Just Bitten that I like better.  Wish this color was a little deeper but it was true to the packaging color so guess I shouldn't complain.

Loving these, and I'll definitely get more in the future.

name: G
review: I absolutely love this product! I bought mine in "precious" it is a nude color for anything I wear and everyday use.  It is similar to a lipstick in texture and goes on like chapstick so it's the best of both worlds!  I want to go back and buy the just bitten deeper red color for the fall.  LOVE.
